citeinfo.origin: Research Data Services (RDS), Columbia University Libraries
citeinfo.title: Carte des Costes de Perse, Gusarat et Malabar : Tiree de la Carte Franoise de l'Ocan Oriental; Publiee Par Ordre de MGR. le Comte De Maurepas, en 1740

descript.abstract: This is a scanned version of the 1780 paper map entitled: Carte des Costes de Perse, Gusarat et Malabar : Tiree de la Carte Franoise de l'Ocan Oriental; Publie Par Ordre de MGR. le Comte De Maurepas, en 1740. The map was scanned at 300 dots per inch and is in the TIFF format.
descript.purpose: Scanned maps may be used for a variety of purposes. This image may be used in a GIS.
descript.supplinf: 1 Map ; 19 x 24 cm Nullmeridian Ferro Abrege de l'histoire generale des voyages. - par M. De La Harpe Paris Tome I in 4 No. 5. Tome 1er in 8, Page 78, [1780] (DE-MnBSB)001:147909341

cntorgp.cntorg: Research Data Services (RDS), Columbia University Libraries

idinfo.datacred: Thanks to Prof. Frances Pritchett, Columbia University, for providing the original paper map for this scan.
idinfo.native: Microsoft Windows XP Version 5.1 (Build 2600) Service Pack 3; ESRI ArcCatalog 9.3.1.3500

dataqual.logic: The raster image is a faithfully reproduced digital image of the original source map. Some differences may be detected between the source graphic used and the raster image due to the RGB values assigned that particular color. The intent is to recreate those colors as near as possible.
dataqual.complete: Data completeness for digitized paper map files reflect the content of the source graphic.
